result.execSummary:
The defendant Bridget Adrianne Blackdeer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

$528.00  including Drug offender diversion surcharge and  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.  If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
9:18 AM Defendant Bridget Adrianne Blackdeer in court, in custody.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Bridget Adrianne Blackdeer.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Plea Questionnaire electronically submitted to Court.  State recites agreement, all parties agree.   Court reviewed information, DEF enters Guilty plea.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds DEF guilty.   State makes statement prior to sentencing.  Attny Otten makes statement prior to sentencing.  DEF makes statement to court.   Court addresses DEF, DEF responds.  Court to follow agreement.  

COURT:  withheld sentence.  3 years probation:  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.   Court costs  $528.00  Includes ($10 Drug Offender Diversion Surcharge) DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.    If revoked, 33 days credit.

1:13 PM  Defendant Bridget Adrianne Blackdeer appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Bridget Adrianne Blackdeer.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin.   DEF agrees to move forward, with no information filed.  State to file information, exact to criminal complaint.   Atty acknowledged receipt of information.  DEF entered NG plea.  Attny Otten request plea/sentencing to be scheduled.

1:11 PM Defendant Bridget Adrianne Blackdeer appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Bridget Adrianne Blackdeer.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Atty Otten indicates DEF waives preliminary hearing.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
